intro: Hibbertia exasperata, commonly known as the scarlet hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright red, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Hibbertia exasperata is an erect shrub that can grow up to 1 meter in height. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is valued for its ornamental appearance in gardens.
